review_title: Good way to enter the Marketing world
pros: Variety of activities and opportunities within the marketing realm Good work/life balance Diverse office Good office space
cons: Big organisation Can feel isolating

review_title: Good if you can handle it
pros: Nice team of people who support each other, the people you work with really make this job. Travelling around the local area for assignments + opportunities to go further afield sometimes. Weekends off.
cons: High turnover rates of fundraisers, most people are let go within a month as the job requires a very specific sort of person to be able to hit targets. The days are tiring and the targets are set high. You're often sent to very rundown towns in the North where people just don't have the money to give and you feel bad even asking. As you'd expect, you receive a lot of abuse from the public as you are basically the most hated person on the street at all times.

cons:
No culture.

Lack of progression.
Poor pay.

review_title: Really great culture and friendly environment to work in
pros: There's a lot of development programs and trainings. Sport teams & events for employees to join. Flexible working hours as long as you get your work done. Everyone's really understanding and helpful. You get your hands on a lot of things as it's not a huge team considering the volume of the whole uk.
cons: Quite limited career development as it's a charitable organisation. Occupations are quite limited.
